timeline.title: Call Center Law & Early Access
timeline.text: Panama passes the Call Center Incentives Law to boost telecom. INTEL privatized, Cable & Wireless dominates. Internet cafés emerge, ~7% population has internet access.

timeline.title: E-Gov Foundations
timeline.text: The government launches the Secretariat for Government Innovation (later AIG). Dial-up begins to fade as ADSL and cable broadband grow in urban areas.

timeline.title: Mobile Competition Expands
timeline.text: Internet use grows to 34%. Digicel and Claro enter in 2008, intensifying mobile competition. Broadband subscriptions increase across the country.

timeline.title: Internet Para Todos
timeline.text: Government launches free public Wi-Fi. By 2014, 1,100+ hotspots are live in 41 cities. Internet access exceeds 40% of the population.

timeline.title: Infoplazas Expand
timeline.text: Infoplazas grow from 214 (2011) to 312 centers by mid-decade. These centers bridge the digital divide in libraries, schools, and communities.

timeline.title: 4G Rollout Begins
timeline.text: Panama launches 4G LTE (2014–15), mobile penetration hits 158%. Broadband subscriptions top 300,000. Cable modem becomes dominant fixed access.

timeline.title: Millicom Enters Broadband
timeline.text: Millicom (Tigo) acquires 80% of Cable Onda, the largest cable/fixed operator. Internet penetration reaches 62% with significant foreign investment.

timeline.title: Tigo Acquires Movistar
timeline.text: Millicom (Tigo) expands into mobile, acquiring Movistar Panamá. Internet users rise to 64% of population, strengthening convergence in services.

timeline.title: Pandemic Drives Demand
timeline.text: COVID-19 pushes internet penetration beyond 70%. Remote work and school drive demand. ISPs expand rural coverage and improve bandwidth.

timeline.title: ISP Market Consolidation
timeline.text: Claro merges with Cable & Wireless in 2022. Digicel exits Panama. Tigo and C&W+Claro dominate the market. Internet access hits ~74%.

timeline.title: Mobile & Fiber Growth
timeline.text: 4G covers 95% of the population. Fiber rolls out in cities. Over 5.3M mobile lines (118% penetration). Internet users reach ~3.5M (79%).

timeline.title: 5G Tests & Digital Plans
timeline.text: Operators begin 5G trials. Panama unveils 2024–2030 Digital Strategy (AI, IoT, fintech). RNI 2.0 and Infoplazas continue expanding access.

timeline.title: Digital Equity Push
timeline.text: Panama launches rural fiber expansion with satellite support. Digital literacy programs increase. Internet penetration nears 82%, aiming for universal coverage.
